# Roguelike Game Inspirations

These notes document the main inspirations from existing roguelike games for this project, including the key features and mechanics that are particularly interesting or influential.

## Main game inspirations

The main game inspirations for this project are, in order of importance:

1. Caves of Qud: The most inspiring elements come from this game.
2. Elin (and also Elona): Both games, although different, are from the same developer and share many similarities.
3. Tales of Maj'Eyal: Some elements are interesting in this game, but it is nowhere near as important an influence as Caves of Qud.

### Inspirations from Caves of Qud

#### Main features

- Deep procedural generation of worlds, locations, and items
- Complex character development with mutations and skills
- Rich lore and storytelling through environmental details
- Factions and reputation systems affecting gameplay
- Turn-based tactical combat
- Extensive use of roguelike mechanics like hunger, thirst, and status effects
- Detailed inventory and equipment management
- Variety of enemy types with unique behaviors
- Extensive use of random events and encounters
- Procedurally generated quests and missions
- Non-linear exploration with multiple paths and secrets
- Integration of traditional roguelike elements with modern gameplay features
- Complex crafting and item modification systems
- Modding support for user-generated content
- Colorful and unique visual style and asymmetric tile sizes
- Atmospheric sound design enhancing immersion
- In-depth mutation system allowing for unique character builds
- In-depth body modification for unique character builds
- Distinct choice between two character types, True Kin and Mutants, each providing a different experience
- Heavy use of ECS

#### Other interesting features

- Permadeath with meaningful progression
- ASCII and tile-based graphics options
- Dynamic weather and environmental effects
- Support for both keyboard and mouse controls
- Robust AI for NPCs and enemies
- Accessibility options for different player needs
- Regular updates and community engagement from developers
- Active modding community with shared content

### Inspirations from Elin (and Elona)

#### Main features

- Open-world exploration with diverse biomes
- Character customization with various races, classes, and traits/feats
- Turn-based combat with tactical depth
- Procedurally generated dungeons and locations
- Extensive item variety with unique properties
- Skill-based progression system
- Extensive crafting system
- Many item modifiers
- Affinity system with NPCs towards the player
- Non-permadeath mode option
- Quests and missions with branching outcomes
- Repeating missions from quest boards
- Income earning and tax payment
- Dynamic world events affecting gameplay
- Player can establish home bases, populate it with residents, improve the bases rank to gain more income, improve their tourism value to attract more guests that produce income, etc.
- Towns
- Some unique, named, non-procedurally generated NPCs
- Skill and stats XP and Potential system
- Many service type NPCs, mostly but not limited to merchants, like:
  - Mages to sell magic scrolls and rods, and to identify items and artifacts for a fee
  - Goods shopkeepers
  - Furniture shopkeepers
  - Bankers
  - Secretaries
  - Healers
  - Blacksmiths
  - etc.
- Many available abilities, skills, feats, spells that can be learned or used via rods, scrolls and potions
- Extensive mod support
- Explorable dungeons with multiple levels, different types, a boss to beat, and good loot as a reward
- Large variety of skills and feats
- God worship system with various deities providing different benefits (buffs, unique items, allies, abilities, etc.) based on their alignment and domains

#### Other interesting features

- Food and hunger mechanics
- Status effects and conditions
- Random events and encounters
- Environmental interactions and hazards
- In the case of Elin: game made to be played entirely with mouse, with point-and-click movement and combat, and context menus for actions, etc., although there is more limited keyboard control support

### Inspirations from Tales of Maj'Eyal

#### Main features

- Deep character customization with classes, talents, and abilities
- Turn-based tactical combat with strategic depth
- Procedurally generated dungeons and locations
- Extensive item variety with unique properties
- Skill-based progression system
- Many abilities/skills to use, and improve at level ups
- Impressive character builds possibilities
- Rich lore and storytelling through environmental details
- Dynamic world events affecting gameplay
- Impressive quantity of interconnected stats and attributes with modifiers
- Some unique outcomes
- Classes are very different from each other and provide a unique experience each, and races are interesting

#### Other interesting features

- Many equipables
- Equipable talismans that passively affect stats and can also actively be use for a particular effect, like healing, teleportation, etc.

## Features to implement

- Procedural generation of levels, items, and enemies
- Permadeath system
- Turn-based and grid-based gameplay
- Complex character progression with skills, attributes, and equipment
- Resource management mechanics
- Exploration and discovery elements
- Random events and encounters
- Status effects, buffs, and debuffs
- Inventory management and item identification
- Environmental interactions
- Player, but also NPC stats and attributes
- Variety of weapons, armor, and combat styles
- Tactical combat mechanics
- Loot and treasure hunting
- Dungeon crawling
- Worldmap with various locations to visit
- Fog of war / unexplored areas
